website_summaries.verdict: Powerful battery that provides a long charge for all your cordless tools.
pros: LED level indicator is perfect for monitoring battery
Durable construction that includes a slipcover
Fully charged in 90 minutes or less
Charging station can simultaneously charge two batteries and communicates throughout the process when charged or a replacement is required
cons: Users reported battery not lasting as long as expected

customer_reviews.title: Short shelf life
customer_reviews.text: Works well for about 3-4 months. Then it gradually needs to be recharged more and more. Its now completely dead after weekly usage, 7 mos later. Major disappointment considering the brand and price.
customer_reviews.author: senorsandman

customer_reviews.title: These Batteries do not last. Purchase 2 in Dec ...
customer_reviews.text: These Batteries do not last . Purchase 2 in Dec. and one will not charge and other will not hold charge. Do not just walk away from this battery "RUN and RUN FAST"
customer_reviews.author: Hunter1

customer_reviews.title: I know the charger is fine since I've charged my 2
customer_reviews.text: The batteries don't seem to charge, I have been charging them for 4 hours but it still doesn't charge. I know the charger is fine since I've charged my 2.0 ah on it.
customer_reviews.author: SAP

customer_reviews.title: These batteries are great. Only downside is I ended up bending the ...
customer_reviews.text: These batteries are great. Only downside is I ended up loosing the screws on my belt clips just a little so they don't scrape with the FLEXVOLT batteries other than that they are monsters. I used to think the 5ah where big, not any more lol.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After only 35 days one of the pair will not charge.
customer_reviews.author: Nashville Donna

customer_reviews.title: Won’t take a charge !
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was very pleased with this item. However, I have had this battery for two months now and have used it very little. Now the battery will not take a charge. It will not even activate the charging light on the charger! I have several of these batteries and they all activate the charger and take a charge.
customer_reviews.author: JIMMY MCCLELLAN

customer_reviews.title: User error or poor material quality?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these batteries Sep 2017 and they have lasted almost 2 years now. This was a good battery until I used it to grind some old welds today. I was extremely impressed with the performance until it overheated and almost fused itself to my grinder. The battery was ran from full charge to 1 bar left in about 35 minuets. Now im left with a damaged grinder and a melted battery. I own over a dozen Dewalt tools in the FlexVolt line and now I'm considering switching over to Milwaukee.
customer_reviews.author: Limginuity

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries but one stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Great batteries batteries but one stopped working a day after the return window. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Serenity

customer_reviews.title: These were the flex PLT. Both batteries quit taking ...
customer_reviews.text: These were the flex PLT. Both batteries quit taking a charge by September.
customer_reviews.author: Ralf

customer_reviews.title: Extends tool use time
customer_reviews.text: I love these because I was able to use my normal 20v charger, and I was able to boost my use time. I was using the tools in the woods at our camp site, and was able to fix everything I needed with no issues at all. Normally my drill, or my reciprocating saw or my chainsaw dies before the work is done. These batteries greatly extend the working time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cranium

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the bigger tools (yet) but have been using them with my circular saw and reciprocal saw the most. They are lasting the day with a lot of use. Just remember to charge them overnight as they take a while.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Compared to the 6ah 20v batteries these run way longer
customer_reviews.text: I got both these and the 6ah 20v batteries. On paper the only difference is these are flex volt. The flex volts are a bit bigger in all directions as well as heavier. On a heavy use tool like a grinder, or a weed eater, it's very noticable the run time difference. I wish I had bought 2 of these kits instead of one 20v 6ah and the 60v kits. Also the tools seem to spool up a bit more. Either way I am sure I will have to buy batteries soon enough. Dewalt batteries seem to only last a year or 2 at best the way I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Benton L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!  Love them.
customer_reviews.text: I love these 60 volt batteries! I bought 2 of these and 2 of the 9 amp hour. These are overall a little smaller than the 9 amp hour dimension wise and also weigh less. Both models have an amazing amount of run time even on my skill saw or grinder. Due to the weight I don't usually run these on my smaller tools like a drill, driver or multi tool, but they do fit. If you have power hungry tools you need more than just a few cuts from, buy these or the 9 amp hour, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: -Dan-

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work after a 2 weeks of low usage. Has still one bar left and works in a tool but doesn't take any charge anymore. Amazon doesn't provide return for these items so it seems(past 30days from purchase) even though it should be under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Rakel Bjork Gunnarsdottir

customer_reviews.title: in my experience, these do not last
customer_reviews.text: As many have said, for some reason both of the batteries failed within 6 months of light use, and by light use I may have charged them a total of 10 times each. admittedly, I procrastinated to send them for the warrantee claim and now I am 1 year 2 months after my original purchase on 3/12/17. So it appears that I have two heavy/ expensive paper weights on my hands. in my experience, these do not last
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: flexvolt!
customer_reviews.text: Currently I only have a 20-volt-max reciprocating saw... it is a replacement for my old 36 volt one whose batteries are finally pooping out. The saw is great. More importantly, dewalt has a bunch of flexvolt tools that are also really nice quality, I imagine that I'll probably end up getting the flexvolt circular saw and maybe even the flexvolt sliding miter saw that runs on two of these 20/60 flexvolt batteries. Tools that need 20-volt-max batteries will run off of flexvolt batteries, but tools that need flexvolt batteries can't use 20-volt-max batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great power, poor durability.
customer_reviews.text: This battery provides plenty of power and it last long. However, I bought this as an upgrade to the original battery pack that came with the impact gun because that battery case started to crack within 3 months of use. To my surprise this heavy duty battery pack also started cracking after about 3 months of use also, and not because it was dropped or mishandled but because of vibration from using it when working on cars So disappointed in the build quality that I wouldn’t even consider buying another one because I feel that the same thing will happen again. And these batteries are not cheap. Mechanics that are thinking of getting this just beware of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: The batteries work great but I bought it with an adapter to work ...
customer_reviews.text: The batteries work great but I bought it with an adapter to work with my collection of 18V XRP tools. The adapter was suggested with these batteries on the Amazon page but when they arrived the adapter did not fit on the batteries because of two "arms" on the front of the adapter. It works fine with regular DeWalt Li-ion batteries but not the Flexvolt version. I ended up cutting off the two arms and it works fine now but either Amazon shouldn't advertise them together or DeWalt should modify their adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Miller

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live with out them now
customer_reviews.text: Great for almost any of the 20v tools. The 60v batteries will run the portable fan all night long which is great for camping and airing out my work trailer all day. I can mix dozens of buckets of compound with a the cordless drill. Run a radio for days. Put them in my compact blower and blow a whole job site off. I use them constantly and I am rough with the tools. They get rained on and left in the heat while I’m working and caked with drywall dust. My Dewalt tools have become detrimental to my drywall contracting business made me much more efficient in my work.
customer_reviews.author: MD P.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries with A/C-like Power
customer_reviews.text: I was able to charge these batteries with the DCB112 charger that I got with my 20v batteries. It takes longer than the DCB118, but the only difference is the speed. They work well with my 20v tools, but my 60v tools don't work with the 20v batteries. Still, a great battery.
customer_reviews.author: DIYer Extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: One of the batteries is not good I’m not using very often I may use 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the batteries is not good I’m not using very often I may use 3 times is not good
customer_reviews.author: Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Battery Pricing Makes the Differencee
customer_reviews.text: For cordless/brushless power tools, the price of the batteries is a "make or break" proposition. They've become the real tool, actually. In some cases, you can buy a corded tool for less than the cost of one of these batteries. So the freedom of cordless has to be the key issue. This vendor had a price on the 2-Pak I couldn't resist. But I can't overstate the necessity of doing some serious shopping, and be ready to buy when you find a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Jones

customer_reviews.title: I'm really glad I made the purchase for these batteries
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad I made the purchase for these batteries! They definitely got a lot of juice to them. I could use my impact and drill all week without having to charge it once. I mostly use self tappers on the work I do so it's a lot better that I have these batteries. I don't have to constantly keep recharging them. They're also really good with a Circular saw. Holds a charge all day and some depending on what kind of wood you're working with. Definitely will recommend to anyone who decides to purchase one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One DEAD in a Year- NOT WORTH the MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the battery in late June and one of the two batteries is dead in a year. I alternate use of the batteries with my power tools. One is still charging fine but the battery life is getting noticeably shorter. My other smaller capacity batteries are older and still going strong. Trade off for longer battery run time versus cost+weight+bulkiness is not worth the money spent. I will go back to the next smaller capacity XR battery next time. Don't even bother with the warranty. Dewalt considers these wearable items on their website and it will be the service center's generosity if they replace them after 30 days from purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer 727

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my new Dewalt string trimmer and they work great! The only gripe I have on the product is that they both came with only one bar of charge, so unless you have a fast charger (recommend) they take HOURS to charge fully. But they last long and work great! I was between two of these or one 9AH and decided that it’d be better to have two of these so I can always swap in a charged one.
customer_reviews.author: BLynch

customer_reviews.title: I can run these all day without needing to recharge
customer_reviews.text: I hated the idea of spending money on replacement batteries. After spending the money and trying these in the field, I so glad I made the change. It took me a little while to get used to the weight difference but it's not bad. I was happy with the charging time and most importantly how long they lasted. I will purchase more of these and I think they're worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: GRB Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are too complicated and have some quirks
customer_reviews.text: The thing about these batteries is that they are built with quality materials and do what they say they will. The problem is that to achieve the 60V 20V compatibility it requires some internal switching. The mechanism they use for this is susceptible to failure. I experienced this with my brushless drill. The pattern would be fully charged but when you hit the trigger sometimes it won't go. This could be because the drill demands higher inrush current or a number of other reasons but its quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Michael holland

customer_reviews.title: best buy, I wish I had a pile of ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, these brought my old 7 1/4 dewalt saw back to life, lasts wayyyyy longer now, and my impact can't hardly run them out, maybe 2-3 days of use all day on the impact, best buy, I wish I had a pile of them. Hey Dewalt, please standardize your batteries, 12v, and 60v are ok as the battery has the ability to switch, but 40V? come on, make an adapter for the 40v so the 60v batteries can be used and just sell ONE BATTERY line. These batteries are the bees knees!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kelly

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: after only a couple uses one battery is shot and will not take charge
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Must buy especially if you have both 60v and 20v tools
customer_reviews.text: The 60v lineup is really nice in that the batteries can be used for my 20v tools which i have amassed. The 6ah is the perfect weight for my blower and trimmer but it does drain much more noticeably than my 9ah. I would say this is a great buy if you have both 60v and 20 v tools. Even if you plan on upgrading or might just need a much more powerful tool in the future its probably better to get the 60v battery just incase.
customer_reviews.author: Reid S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing run time on 20V tools, great on the 60V tools also.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries are great, my 20V tools run for a long time with these high capacity batteries, and I get good use out of the 60V circular saw I bought them for. Heavier & larger than the 3A batteries I was using, but it's great to change batteries less often. The batteries came with a nice contact cover to protect against accidental shorts.
customer_reviews.author: TED T

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: When fully charged, they are the real deal, it last long enough to weed, edge, and without changing batteries power the blower when plenty of power left, you might just forget to charge it. I used it on my chain saw and it outlasted and had more power than the 5 amp. Power is there and longevity, well worth it, got it on sale at $149.00 for two. should have gotten 4.
customer_reviews.author: vee99

customer_reviews.title: HE-MAN battery packs
customer_reviews.text: With these packs, you'll have the power just like He-Man. Don't try to run the DeWalt weedeater with the smaller batteries, you'll be frustrated. You need these to run the weedeater. Trust me. Thought I made a huge mistake before getting theses, the correct batteries. Best part is, you can use these on the circular saw, sawzall, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Silence

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was ecstatic to have these beasts come in early, all of his batteries were spent. This sucker helps him get through the toughest jobs, and this is a man that breaks every tool he has. Thankfully his DeWALT's hold up to his intense abuse!
customer_reviews.author: April Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over standard 20v batteries
customer_reviews.text: I originally intended to use these in my 7 1/2" dewalt 20v compound miter saw. But I find they work great and last longer in all my dewalt tools. Probably will get the 9 ah for the miter saw and use these for recip saw, circ saw and impact driver.
customer_reviews.author: JimM

customer_reviews.title: Price point needs to come down
customer_reviews.text: We know technology has made these cheap enough to make. No idea why they are still sticking it to us. This is the future but the battery prices hurt. I have 1800 in batteries and 2200 in tools. I have almost all the tools. That shows how far off things are. I like having extra batteries because some days I can use up to 10 of 14 batteries. They have us over a barrel
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: These batteries are freaking amazing!!! I love them. They are a bit pricey but are worth it. Wait for them to go on sale. I did and definitely don't regret it. This was a great addition to my Dewalt collection.
customer_reviews.author: brtundrgrnd

customer_reviews.title: ... put up to 400plus screws a day and way better performance out of your tool would highly recommend get ...
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing a dewalt drill and impact I put them to work on self tapping screws on my steel building the little 2amp battery’s that come with kit I would lucky to put 20 screws in and the batteries and would be dead this new 60v batteries will last me all day with ability to put up to 400plus screws a day and way better performance out of your tool would highly recommend get this battery if you really plain on getting the most demand out of ur new tool instead of waiting for the little batteries to charge all the time the only thing these 60 volt batteries take about three hours to charge but last all day
customer_reviews.author: zack keith

customer_reviews.title: Get this two pack and you can keep yourself going all day with 1 charger.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE Dewalt products. These are like $10 more than the traditional 20v batteries and well worth the money. By putting these on your tools you get significantly more power out of tools like your basic impact driver (dcf885) and longevity compared to the small 1.6-2amp batterys and even the 5amps will have you asking yourself "why didn't I buy these sooner?".
customer_reviews.author: Ian Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Sick!
customer_reviews.text: makes all my tools feel alive! Lol. These are great. If you own dewalt saws these and find it frustrating with running the normal batteries you will be happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Routinely defective
customer_reviews.text: Started off wonderful, but in a few months with light use they began to fail to fully charge. In the end they got about 1 bar of charge. I took them into the local dewalt ship who tested them, declared them faulty, and replaced them free of charge. A few months later I was I the same boat again.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary T. Hope

customer_reviews.title: Works good for me
customer_reviews.text: They work good. When you need the longer battery life. I use them in the circular saw, grinder, router, and die grinder. They do not work in the 18volt adapter, the battery is shaped alittle different, so i cannot use them in the sawzall. Look around on amazon, you can find them in 2 battery set for around 180.
customer_reviews.author: richl

customer_reviews.title: Maine used during power outages
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these batteries to use during power outages to power a couple of Dewalt flashlights and to use with a USB adapter to keep phones and tablets charged. I haven’t used them much but have had no issues with them. In my past experiences I have not ha any problems with Dewalt batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you are probably looking at this AFTER you've completed a long project where you had to charge up a bunch of times and been delayed when both your batteries are down. I looked these up every time I had just finished a big job, and then reasoned out of ordering them every time based on the premise that I had just finished what I was working on, so I don't need them now... Do yourself a favor and JUST ORDER THEM! Inevitably you'll have another project and you will once again be stuck dealing with dead batteries. You won't regret having the extended life even for the most basic of projects.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Vargason

customer_reviews.title: Great battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a number of Dewalt tools that Came with 1.3Ah batteries. Was not impressed with the tools at all. No run time!! Now that I have purchased the 6.0 Ah batteries I now love my tools as they seem to run “forever “
customer_reviews.author: Margaret McGibbon

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, But Last Forever
customer_reviews.text: Took me a long time to bite the bullet and buy these batteries, but I finally talked myself into it. I have a lot more batteries than just these two, but honestly with just these two batteries, I guarantee that your dewalt tools will make it through the day with juice to spare.
customer_reviews.author: David Holman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power upgrade from my 20V system - even though this is flexvolt and it operates tools at 20V, it is still a noticeably stronger battery. A bit larger though, but not that much heavier
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Hey , these batteries are junk... charge them up, the battery indicator stays on the 1st light, never goes up to full, and I can drill 4 holes...was expecting these to be awesome, I stand by Dewalt tools, hopefully this is just a bad batch...totally disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.author: CLAYTON C

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the Investment for the Run Time and Durability.
customer_reviews.text: These are true DeWalt, Need I say any more? These batteries last a long time when used on a 20volt tool.
customer_reviews.author: RKS

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt 20/60V Flex batteries are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Wow.... These are lightyears ahead of the old 18 Volt NiCads. Not much more to say. They last forever. Hopefully DeWalt will keep This style around for at least 20 years. It gets expensive for us little guys to change all our stuff out whenever they change battery systems. These are great. Best of all time so far.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Powerful short lifetime value!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly powerful battery - however, for the money they should last longer than 4 months!!
customer_reviews.author: C.A. Tyre

customer_reviews.title: Works all week
customer_reviews.text: When i bought this i figured it would last awhile longer than the 20v batteries but these will work all week on a job site. It really amazed me how long they last. once you get use to the extra weight it is a huge time saver not having to go back for new batteries on a job site.
customer_reviews.author: JonnyV

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: One battery would not charge at all the day they arrived. I had to return them. I am a big fan of the whole Dewalt 20-60 volt lineup but there are what I think are more than a few bad reviews about these batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The battery would not charge.
customer_reviews.text: The battery would not charge after one use. Not happy at all. I have 2 of DCB606 and one of DCB609. DCB609 does not charge also. Only DCB606 charges! poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Kaushik Sheth

customer_reviews.title: Brings tools to life
customer_reviews.text: These batteries last forever. Well, maybe not forever, but a long time. They really step up the power level of the tools. They are considerably heavier than the lesser batteries, so be prepared to grow forearms. Every DeWalt kit needs them. Recommend you get the fast charger for these or the charge time is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Dapper

customer_reviews.title: Super happy :)
customer_reviews.text: If you have DEWALT power tools these batteries are a must have. I've had these for 1 year and they've never disappointed me. Battery life is incredible, I charge mine once every month or so, with normal everyday use. Built quality is good, sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cann

customer_reviews.title: Super long lasting batteries
customer_reviews.text: Great batteries. Each one latest easily three days on my power drill a dewalt DCD996B on tough uses. And on my dewalt DCL074 light 6 hours on high beam. Just love these batteries the only downside to me is the weight, they weight a lot (about 4.5 pounds) so its kinda tiring carrying your drill or vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Ohz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the saws
customer_reviews.text: Can run 20v tools all day. Works great in the demo saw. Used for my living, worth buying over the standard 20v
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Yea, they are original dewalt 6. 0 bats ...
customer_reviews.text: Yea, they are original dewalt 6.0 bats. What else is there to say. Got them just after getting dewalt 20v recip saw. These things last a long long time. We did a major remodel in the house. With the quick charger i was never without power.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on a great product. I am not a heavy user, just use it with a dewalt blower. It usually has enough power to take care of the gravel in my front yard. It's a 60v max tool and lasts about 1hr of continuous use at full power.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to the 6.0 after having to charge my 1.3 and 2.0 amp batteriess every hour. these batteries work in my garage all day long. use them for 1/2 impact, sawzall, impact driver, grinder and skill saw. wish i would have bought a extra set when they was priced at $150.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: bad
customer_reviews.text: one of them leaked, never got a reply from anyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Batteries won't charge
customer_reviews.text: These batteries was hardly used and both of them won't charge it shows hot cold delay what's the problem can I exchange them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Great batteries! Even though these batteries are large, they balanced very well on my DeWalt trim saw, and reciprocating saw, and saber saw. Used one battery on and off all day without charging. Longevity rates one only because I have only had the batteries a month and longevity remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Voss

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: How can't you love DeWalt? Awesome! Work great with my 1/2" impact driver. to not have these or even the higher capacity is just pointless. if you own DeWalt then buy this!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he was.every and is still very happy with the performance out of the batteries. The life.on them.after charging them is great. He uses them.on a daily and has had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Muncy

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and economical
customer_reviews.text: Great value. These run all day vs the 5 amp batteries. Now I don’t have to take so many batteries to job sites. Just 3 of these instead of 8-10 smaller ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sosadnomad

customer_reviews.title: One of them still works...
customer_reviews.text: One of the batteries stop working after just a handful of charges. Had the battery almost a year and only charged a few times before it was unable to charge at all. Very disappointed for how much they cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt 20v tools are great
customer_reviews.text: I gave a couple two batteries wasn’t enough do all my desalt tools. I just bought the job site radio so I thought I needed two more batteries for it . I’m a definitely in the 20v Dewalt family love them all
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Try it right the way
customer_reviews.text: I bought two battery and none of them are working. Don’t know why even it doesn’t charge. I tested with a different charger but stil won’t charge
customer_reviews.author: Tudor

customer_reviews.title: SuperBattery
customer_reviews.text: Wow, if a powertool battery was a superhero these would have to be hands down Superman. Powerful 6 AH 20 V!! Need I say more. Purchased these for my new Dewalt HEAVY DUTY copper cable automatic cable cutter and worked out like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Sal The Electrician

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: These things are beasts! I trimmed my entire front and back yard with these on the 20v hedge trimmers and it still have 2 Bars left! To give you an idea, I trimmed roughly 60 hedges and a fence line that was over grown with ivy...
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries do not last.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 of these in 2018. Now 18 months later, I only have 3 still take a charge and they don't run a tool for long. Expensive junk. My 2 amp hour dewalt 20v batteries have lasted longer than these. Also, these batteries never worked with my dewalt 20v leaf blower.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: 0 Ah worked great for the drill
customer_reviews.text: I was temporarily using the 2.0 Ah batteries that came with my drill for my circular saw. The 2.0 Ah worked great for the drill, but ran out of power quickly on the circular saw after cutting a dozen or so 2x6s at best. A single one of these new 6.0 Ah run my circular saw nearly all day (8+ hrs), and since this package came with 2 batteries I'm able to charge one while using the other. I no longer have to worry about running out of juice, these 6.0 Ah batteries are perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Julian

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about these were the price. Since it was freaky, we knew we were getting a quality product. We were going to buy these from our local hardware store and they were $70 more there so we ordered them from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L Walters

customer_reviews.title: Impressive capacity.
customer_reviews.text: These batteries with a 20v chainsaw give about the same use time/power as a tank of gas in an ultralight gas saw- but no pull start/exhaust fumes- remarkable! Huge upgrade from the 5ah 20v- the numbers are deceiving- I’d guess 30-40% more runtime over 5ah batts using a chainsaw. It may take you longer to pick up what you’ve cut then it will take to recharge.... feels like the future.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Strong, last long
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work very long first time but after second full charge they were one of the best purchases IV ever made. Put a 32' ledger in and drilled all the 4" tapcon holes and inserted them with the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: dead already. Cannot find any service center for warranty cannot contact customer service.
customer_reviews.author: rocap

customer_reviews.title: One is defective
customer_reviews.text: I received 2 pieces, and work good for the first time, then when I tried to charge, one of then won't,
customer_reviews.author: Fausto Penaranda

customer_reviews.title: Battery wont charge
customer_reviews.text: It wont charge anymore. Stays on one bar. I Bought it january.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Mizuno

customer_reviews.title: These batteries are awesome. I run 5 of them now
customer_reviews.text: These batteries are awesome. I run 5 of them now. We use 1/4, 1/2 and 3/4 impacts all day at work. They last all day. I run them in my sawzall too. Fricken insane run time and seams to add a extra power to every tool we put them in. None of my employees complain about the weight. They fight to use them. Will probably order a few more next week. Very happy with the 60 volt system.
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: The battery lasted a long time
customer_reviews.text: I got this battery for use in the Dewalt string trimmer and the battery lasted a very long time trimming. It was still ready to trim even after I was worn out
customer_reviews.author: John Longmire

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great batteries, they are pretty heavy when you use them with drills, so I don’t recommend them for that use. For large cordless tools light their air compressors or jigsaws or hammer drills they do awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Real deal
customer_reviews.text: Best deal around.I own lots of these, you can't beat the price for two in the store. They come clam shell packed in the original unopened packaging. They don't seem to be knockoffs in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Duffecker

customer_reviews.title: don't last
customer_reviews.text: These are too heavy for what you get. they don't last as long as the regular 20 volt which are less heavy. I already have one replaced.
customer_reviews.author: pepe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome batteries.
customer_reviews.text: We have a commercial construction company. The guys love these batteries. They make the tools far better and last a long time between charges.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Garner

customer_reviews.title: battery life
customer_reviews.text: bought this battery in july 2020 its now oct 2020 and battery is already dead WTH
customer_reviews.author: mike b

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding battery
customer_reviews.text: Good quality battery! Using this battery on my grinder and is such an improvement in battery life. I also use it on my impact and seems to stay on impact better than the smaller battery. Charges up like it is supposed to and stays charged while idle. Good product, well worth the extra money of a knock off battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Runs all day for a DIY’er
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 6 Ah batteries for my saws (circular, reciprocating, jig, oscillating) and drills (hammer, impact wrench). And for my DIY weekend projects, they last all day........sometimes the whole weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Do last a long longer before recharging but the weight ...
customer_reviews.text: Do last a long longer before recharging but the weight makes the tool heavier and a little off balance. Will see how long they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: StormMaster

customer_reviews.title: Set your $ on fire
customer_reviews.text: $160.00 spent on 2 60V Dewalt batteries. They do not power a 60V DeWalt grinder- but will work 20V tools
customer_reviews.author: Recalcitrant

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last...
customer_reviews.text: The battery stopped working today after 14 months. Pretty disappointed that at $130.00 battery only lasted that long.
customer_reviews.author: bs07242

customer_reviews.title: great price and value
customer_reviews.text: Great price half of what you can but in store. Have only recently purchased them so can't rate the longevity of the battery , but thus far far better than the 6hr 20V lithium I use in past. I will definitely purchase more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: these seem to be more durable then their 20v component ...
customer_reviews.text: these seem to be more durable then their 20v component. The battery cases on the 20v don't hold up to our industrial use (cracking where the cases are screwed together). We haven't had that issue with the 60v batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Long life and lots of power
customer_reviews.text: Great batteries for the price. They work especially well for the Dewalt yard tools I have.
customer_reviews.author: THE MAN

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but you learn why
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to support my power station but learned quickly at how long batteries' technology has come with my DeWalt wet/dry vac. Hours.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Sattler

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I love these batteries. A little have but go damn the power. Must have for anyone with dewalt cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: The one true reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Got it for my weed eater. Worked better than the battery that it came with
customer_reviews.author: Paul Olivas

customer_reviews.title: This is why I use Dewalt  20volt,6a max
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these and it will run any and all power tools all day own the job,most days I only use one.one for the fan and one for tool and last one as a backup. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Bob

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Kinda expensive but worth it. It’s been couple weeks on same charge on a cordless grider
customer_reviews.author: Danny Lee

product_meta.title: DEWALT DCB606 20/60V MAX FLEXVOLT 6.0 Ah Battery 1 Pack
product_meta.description: Size:1 PackThe DEWALT DCB606 20/60V MAX* FLEXVOLT battery pack 6.0 Ah allows you the power of corded with the freedom of cordless. This battery pack offers 4X runtime compared to DCB201 1.5 Ah battery pack / 3X power compared to DC9096 18V battery. It features durable construction with single piece cell holder, with an LED state of charge display. Because it automatically changes voltages when you change tools , you can slide the battery into a whole new lineup of tools from DEWALT; it features tri-platform compatibility with 20V MAX*, 60V MAX*, and 120V MAX*. No need to invest in a whole new system. This revolutionary battery will change the way things get done! Includes: (1) DCB606 flexible battery.**4X the runtime compared to DCB201 1.5Ah Battery Pack.
feature_bullets: 3X THE POWER: When compared to the DC9096 18V Battery.
4X RUNTIME**: 6.0Ah capacity when used in 20V MAX* tools.
DUAL-VOLTAGE FOR FLEXIBILITY: Compatible with all 20V MAX*, 60V MAX* and 120V MAX* tools.
COMPATIBLE WITH 20V MAX* CHARGER: Compatible with any 20V MAX*charger with a charge time of one hour.
STATE OF CHARGE DISPLAY: LED battery charge indicator allows you to view current state of charge.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,111 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
